text: Sergei Nailevich Gimayev (; 1 January 1955 – 18 March 2017) was a Russian professional ice hockey player. He was born in Moscow. He played ten seasons (1976–86) in the Soviet Championship League with HC CSKA Moscow and Leningrad SKA. After the end of his career as a player, Gimayev worked as a TV sports presenter. Gimayev died in Tula, Russia on 18 March 2017 from a heart attack, caused by thrombosis, aged 62. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1955 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Russian ice hockey players Category:Russian television presenters Category:Sportspeople from Moscow
title: Sergei Gimayev
